It is not a vow that I have always been able to keep.”Francis Wyndham, The Other Garden “At the beginning of a new notebook I copy a quote from Simone Weil, which captures me completely: ‘Don’t insist on understanding new things, but try with your whole self, with patience, effort and method, to comprehend obvious truths.’ ¶ This quote conducts a polemic with the ceaseless, barbaric pursuit of novelty and disdain for obvious, primary truths. ¶ And so all my notes, all these snail’s traces, are the realization of Simone’s one thought. Widely used software for building anything that touches network packets. Free; BSD-like license. DCCP (Datagram Congestion Control Protocol). Tenet, an architecture for tiered embedded networks. Sensor network software built around a simple, pluggable tasklet abstraction. XORP, the eXtensible Open Router Platform. HotCRP. Slick and powerful conference management software. Free; BSD-like license. Ipsumdump. Translates tcpdump files, or other packet sources, into a human- and program-readable ASCII format. Free; BSD-like license. Gifsicle. A command-line tool for creating, editing, and getting information about GIF images and animations. Free; GPL-like license. LCDF Typetools. Nine programs for dealing with Type 1, multiple-master, and OpenType fonts. Includes cfftot1, mmafm, mmpfb, otfinfo, otftotfm, t1dotlessj, t1lint, t1reencode, and t1testpage. Free; GPL. T1utils. Six programs for manipulating Adobe Type 1 fonts. Includes t1ascii, t1binary, t1asm, t1disasm, t1mac, and t1unmac. Free; BSD-like license. Xbraitenberg. X-based Braitenberg vehicle simulator, with ârealisticâ pseudophysics and collisions. Free; BSD-like license. Xmahjongg. X-based mah jongg solitaire game. Free; GPL. Portable Xshostakovich++ 98!! Silly X thing. Free; Open Profanity License. Xwrits. X-based wrist break reminder. Free; GPL. Dormant Asbestos, an operating system built around decentralized information flow. Eel, the Explicit Event Library. An event-driven programming library amenable to program analysis, and several analysis tools. Developed by Ryan Cunningham. Prolac. A language for writing readable network protocol implementations. Xzewd. An X11/Motif Zephyr interface, with perks. Free, but MIT-specific.
